data.text: @Protean_Man the 3% is only applicable to the 42,086 case reports of adverse affects from Pfizers study, i.e. 3% of side effects reports were fatalities

@bitAnonOrg You're assuming the data collected about deaths and side effects through public and private sources is accurate and fully reported.

The 3% is from pfizers data, do what you want with that.
@Protean_Man Actual risks of Pfizer vaccination side effects was 0.05% and fatality was 0.0015%. NOT 3%! https://t.co/NLrBM942fr

Vaccine group vs. Placebo group (no vax).
Thanks to @MichaelPSenger for this image. https://t.co/6Tjt0IadOU

@WheresTheHealth @Protean_Man So if the denominator is the number of doses, then why would they redact that number, if that is the only way to get to percentages of fatalaties?  Also if we don't have the data for that number then surely that means we don't have additional possible death data either?

@Protean_Man You're misinterpreting the fatalities in that table.
https://t.co/8GO0qc6Q0r
@Protean_Man Numbers are skewed because of huge number of total vax given.  Wonder how this compares to VIOXX disaster on a per dose basis. That was a huge lawsuit.
